intro: Paypayrola guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan paypayrola, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Paypayrola guianensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
